messageBody:
Hi Haddad,
Unit testing threads can be difficult. Hopefully, one of the forthcoming
books will focus on testing patterns. While you wait, you can check out the
information on http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?ExtremeProgrammingChallengeFourteen -
concurrency. Most things can be tested if you're determined enough.

When you write a test, it is always useful to consider "what does my code
need to guarrantee here". It seems to me like you could verify that the
"Machinelistener" was among the active threads in the VM between the
constructor and the call to switch-off. I can't really say, though, it's
your code.


Sincerely,
Johannes Brodwall
PS. For more info on books, see http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?WhosWritingAboutXp
